metadata.title: CVE-2019-11360 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - negligible
metadata.description:
A buffer overflow in iptables-restore in netfilter iptables 1.8.2 allows anattacker to (at least) crash the program or potentially gain code executionvia a specially crafted iptables-save file. This is related toadd_param_to_argv in xshared.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11360` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

iptables - 1.8.3-2ubuntu4
libip4tc2 - 1.8.3-2ubuntu4
libip6tc2 - 1.8.3-2ubuntu4
libiptc0 - 1.8.3-2ubuntu4
libxtables12 - 1.8.3-2ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: iptables package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8.3-2ubuntu4').
